pageTitle: Nominate employees for Outstanding Maverick Awards
body: Know a great employee or team of employees? Suggest them for the Outstanding Maverick Awards. Submit nominations online by Friday, Feb. 9. For questions or concerns, contact Eunice Currie at hrspecialprojects@uta.edu or 817-272-7091.

pageTitle: Volunteer for All-Majors Job Fair
body: The Lockheed Martin Career Development Center needs volunteers to help make the Spring All-Majors Job Fair a success. Volunteer online by Friday, Feb. 16. The fair is 10 a.m.-3 p.m., Wednesday, Feb. 21, in the Maverick Activities Center.

pageTitle: RSVP for Institutional Review Board Mini-Conference
body:
The Institutional Review Board (IRB) Mini-Conference is for UTA faculty, staff, and students who conduct human subject research and want to learn about the IRB application process. The event is 9 a.m.-4:30 p.m. Friday, Feb. 16, in the sixth floor atrium of the Central Library.

Breakfast and lunch included. RSVP required. View the schedule and RSVP.

Regulatory Services hosts the event.

pageTitle: Construction on Davis Drive may cause detours
body:
Be prepared for detours and street closures along Davis Drive for the next year. The City of Arlington will begin Phase I of the Davis Upper Pressure Plane Expansion project on Monday, Feb. 5.

The project includes replacement of water and sanitary sewer lines from Park Row Drive to UTA Boulevard. The project will take about one year to complete. Streets may be closed to through traffic during construction.

A public information meeting on the project is 6-7 p.m. Wednesday, Jan. 31, at City Hall.

Look for updates at arlington-tx.gov/waterconstruction/davis-pressure-plane-project.

pageTitle: Stay connected with UTA social media
body: Stay up-to-date with the latest events and innovations at UTA on the official social media channels. To see a list of University-hosted social media pages and groups and to learn more about how your department, program, or campus organization can utilize social networking platforms, go to UTA’s social media index and social media guidelines.

pageTitle: Form 1095-C shows health care coverage
body:
Between now and March 2 some employees will receive the 1095-C tax form that contains information about their 2017 health care coverage. If you enrolled in health coverage with UTA or worked an average of 30 or more hours per week, you should receive a Form 1095-C.

The information on the form will be your documentation to prove your insurance coverage status and will serve as your supporting documentation for your records. You do not need to send this form with your tax return.

If you have any questions, please email benefits@uta.edu or call 817-272-5554.

pageTitle: Walk 10 minutes on Feb. 9 for UT System Heart Walk
body:
The UTA Wellness Committee invites you to to walk for 10 minutes anytime between 10 a.m.-10 p.m. Friday, Feb. 9, for the UT System Heart Walk. Walk around campus or the hallways or stairs in your building. Join the committee at Texas Hall box office area at 10 a.m for the walk.

If you would like a Heart Walk collector's pin, meet at Texas Hall.

pageTitle: 'Teaching Kitchen' event includes cooking lesson
body: Dining Services invites students, faculty, and staff to participate in “Teaching Kitchen” 2-4 p.m. Wednesday, Jan. 24, in the Connection Café in the University Center. The free cooking session with Executive Chef David Aldape will focus on a super grain bowl. Space is limited. Register online.

pageTitle: Nominate colleagues for Regentsâ€™ Outstanding Employee Award
body:
The Regents’ Outstanding Employee Award (ROEA) seeks to recognize 30 UT System employees per year from across our institutions for their outstanding performance, innovation, enthusiasm, and dedication in their jobs. ROEA winners receive $10,000 awards and are honored at a luncheon hosted by the UT System chancellor and Board of Regents.

The deadline to submit the nomination packets is 5 p.m. Wednesday, Jan. 31. Please visit the Human Resources' ROEA website for more details, including specific instructions about how to apply.

pageTitle: Network maintenance to disrupt service early Sunday
body:
The Office of Information Technology will perform additional maintenance on the UTA campus network infrastructure early Sunday mornings in February.

Over the next several weeks, the UTA network will undergo infrastructure upgrades that will ensure continued stability and reliability of the internet, network, and IT services for the campus community. During these upgrades, there will be a temporary disruption in network services during IT regular maintenance to limit any impact to business activities. UTA resources—such as shared drives, Pharos Printing, and other network-accessed resources—will be temporarily unavailable during this upgrade.

Read more about dates and times.

If you have any questions or concerns, please contact the IT Help Desk at 817-272-2208, helpdesk@uta.edu, or through the self-service site.

pageTitle: Black Leadership Institute applications due Feb. 6
body:
Register now to be part of the 10th Anniversary Black Leadership Institute (BLI) set for 8 a.m.–4:30 p.m. Saturday, Feb. 10, on the first floor of Nedderman Hall.

The BLI is an a one-day conference focused on the history and contemporary issues facing the black community. Enjoy networking activities, keynote speaker, and breakout workshops. This free program is open to all UTA students.

Register by Tuesday, Feb. 6. Read more.

pageTitle: CAPS sponsors mental health workshops for faculty, staff
body:
Counseling and Psychological Services has partnered with MHMR Tarrant County to host Mental Health First Aid training on campus.

Learn how to help a person who may be experiencing a mental health-related crisis or problem. Topics include anxiety, depression, psychosis, and addiction.

For faculty and staff, the free programs are 8:30 a.m.-4 p.m. with a 30-minute lunch on your own. Registration is required through uta.edu/caps.

Workshops are:

• Friday, Feb. 9, Room 315A, Central Library

• Friday, Feb. 16, San Saba Room, University Center

• Friday, March 2, Room 601, Nedderman Hall

• Tuesday, March 13, Room 315A, Central Library

• Wednesday, April 4, Room 315A, Central Library

pageTitle: Volunteer Opportunity Exchange
body:
Looking for a place to volunteer for yourself or maybe add volunteer hours for your organization or class? Do you need a community partner for your service learning course? Maybe you want to connect with local agencies for internship and job possibilities.

Stop by the Volunteer Opportunity Exchange, a nonprofit agency tabling event which will be held from 10 a.m.-1 p.m. Friday, Jan. 26, in the Bluebonnet Ballroom of the University Center. This informal event is to enable faculty, staff, student organizations, campus departments, and individuals to network with community partners about ongoing or short-term service learning or volunteer opportunities.

There will be snacks, giveaways, and raffle prizes for attendees. Contact Susan DeQueant of the Center for Service Learning at dequeant@uta.edu for more information about the event.

pageTitle: Nominate an Outstanding Academic Advisor
body:
UTA recognizes that advising is a critical component for a student’s academic success. To recognize their contributions, each year two outstanding advisors—one faculty advisor and one professional advisor—are honored for their work. These advisors demonstrate characteristics such as respect, care, and concern for students and for their goals; responsiveness to students’ needs; resourcefulness; and knowledge of University policies and procedures.

Nominations for Outstanding Academic Advisor are due by Monday, Feb. 16.   

More details and the nomination form are at uta.edu/outstandingadvisor.

pageTitle: Save date for HUB, Supply Chain Alliance fair
body:
Mark your calendar for the annual Historically Underutilized Businesses (HUB) and UT System Supply Chain Alliance Vendor Fair on Wednesday, April 18.

The event brings representatives from companies for office supplies, office furniture, flowers, promotional items, computers, apparel, signs, and much more. The fair is 9 a.m.-noon in the Bluebonnet Ballroom of the University Center to showcase their wares. Promotional items, refreshments, games, and prizes will be available.

For details, contact Laurie Thompson, HUB Coordinator, at 817-272-2039 or lauriethompson@uta.edu or Charles Brooks, senior contract specialist, at 817-272-2140 or charles.brooks@uta.edu.

pageTitle: Check list for Employee Service Awards
body:
Through the Service Awards Program, the University honors faculty and staff members reaching milestones of 10 years or more.

Employees and departments are encouraged to review the 2018 Service Awards list for accuracy. Email any changes, additions, or deletions to hrspecialprojects@uta.edu by Friday, Feb. 9.

On Wednesday, April 4, the University will host a dinner to honor employees with 25, 30, 35, 40, and 45 years of service.

Employees with 10, 15, and 20 years of service will be honored at an afternoon reception.

pageTitle: Update your contact information for MavAlert system
body:
UTA's MavAlert Emergency Notification System rapidly notifies faculty, staff, and students in the event of a campus emergency via registered email addresses and text message devices. Verify your contact information at uta.edu/mymav.

The MavAlert test will coincide with the regular monthly test of the Outdoor Warning System at 12:30 p.m. on the first Wednesday of each month. The City of Arlington's monthly weather warning test will follow at 1 p.m. The next test is Wednesday, Feb. 7.

pageTitle: Verify, update personal info
body: The beginning of a new year is a great time to update your information. Human Resources is asking all employees to login to UT Share and update their information. Please verify your home address, phone number, W-4 information, ethnicity, and veteran status. Job Aids on how to update your information can be found on the Business Affairs Training and Development website.

pageTitle: Got an Outstanding Student Employee?
body:
Nominate your outstanding student employee to be honored by UTA.

The winners of the undergraduate and graduate student employee awards will each receive $1,000 and will be entered to win a $10,000 scholarship. Second place winners will receive $500. All nominees will be honored for their outstanding performances.

Visit uta.edu/careers/faculty-staff for more information on the Outstanding Student Employee Awards. All nominations are due by Monday, Feb. 19.

pageTitle: SAC partners with Phillipâ€™s Wish for blanket, winter wear drive
body:
The Staff Advisory Council is collecting items for Phillip’s Wish, a non-profit organization providing sleeping bags, blankets, warmth, and compassion to the homeless.

Items needed include new or gently used coats, hats, gloves, scarves, blankets, and sleeping bags. Donations are due by Tuesday, March 13.

Start a collection box in your office or drop off items at one of these locations.

  • Room 101, Maverick Activities Center (Marie Reddick)
  • Room 203, Carlisle Hall (Margie Jackymack)
  • Arlington Regional Data Center (Carla Monk)
  • Room 508A, Hammond Hall (Tahanee Manning)

pageTitle: FabLab hosts power tool training, safety workshops
body:
Learn how to use some of the power tools in the FabLab.

Workshops cover general shop safety, abrasive tools, band saws, scroll saws, jigsaws, compound miter saws, drills and drill presses, plasma cutters, and table saws.

See the schedule for times and dates. All are in the FabLab shop room on the first floor of the Central Library.

pageTitle: 'Romancing the Stars' returns to Planetarium for Valentine's Day
body:
Bring your significant other to the Planetarium at UTA for Romancing the Stars on Valentine's Day, Wednesday, Feb. 14. Enjoy a journey through the night sky to some of the most romantic and awe-inspiring places in the universe.

There will be a reception with light snacks and drinks between the 5 p.m. and 7 p.m. showings. Cost is $12 per person.

Stay around for Pink Floyd's Dark Side of the Moon at 8 p.m. The 5.1 surround-sound music is set to immersive and surrealistic CG effects in a dome environment. The album covers topics that some parents may not find suitable for children. Tickets are $4 for UTA students, faculty, staff, and seniors, and $6 for general public.

For more details, call 817-272-1183 or email planetarium@uta.edu.

pageTitle: Network upgrades continue this month
body:
The UTA network will undergo extensive maintenance and upgrades in February. These improvements will provide stability and support upcoming University initiatives.

To minimize the disruption to the University, network maintenance is scheduled for 2-7 a.m. Sunday, Feb. 11.

Faculty, staff, and students will not have access to UTA network-accessed resources during the upgrades. The Office of Information Technology recommends faculty, staff, and students make other work and school arrangements to avoid any service or work interruptions.

For more information about the schedule, please visit uta.edu/oit. If you have questions or concerns, contact the IT Help Desk at 817-272-2208 or helpdesk@uta.edu, or use the self-service website.

pageTitle: Celebrate Mardi Gras with buffet at University Club
body:
Let the good times roll for Mardi Gras at the Bourbon St. Buffet 11 a.m.-2 p.m. Tuesday, Feb. 13, at the University Club in Davis Hall. Cost is $8.80 per person for the meal.

The menu includes blackened chicken etouffee, ratatouille, Creole tilapia, chicken gumbo with rice, caesar salad, New Orleans-style potatoes, red beans and rice, cornbread, hush puppies, and garlic-buttered broccoli.

Finish the meal with king cake or bananas foster with caramel sauce. Try the Hurricane mocktail made with fruit punch, grenadine, and tonic water.

pageTitle: Bike share offers new discounts
body:
UTA’s bike-share program now offers new pricing options.

Rides are priced for every 30 minutes for 50 cents instead of in one-hour increments.

Use the promo code Maverick20 for $20 off an annual membership. The code expires Thursday, March 15, 2018.

Visit bike.zagster.com/uta to sign up and for more details about the bike-share program, including a map of bike station locations.

pageTitle: Sign up now for hearing screening offered at SAC Benefits Fair
body: Register for a free hearing screening during the SAC Benefits Fair on Wednesday, March 14. The screening is provided by Kos/Danchak. The fair is 11 a.m.-1:30 p.m. in the Bluebonnet Ballroom of the University Center.

pageTitle: Blood drive donors needed during SAC Benefits Fair
body: Donors are needed for a blood drive during the Staff Advisory Council's Benefits Fair on Wednesday, March 14. The fair and the drive are 11 a.m.-1:30 p.m. in the Bluebonnet Ballroom of the University Center. Register to donate.

pageTitle: Register for pain assessment at SAC Benefits Fair
body:
Airrosti Rehab Centers will offer free pain and injury assessments at the Staff Advisory Council's Benefits Fair.

After an evaluation of pain-related issues, representatives will review the findings with you and discuss treatment options. Register online or call 855-283-2457.

The SAC Benefits Fair is 11 a.m.-1:30 p.m. Wednesday, March 14, in the Bluebonnet Ballroom of the University Center.

pageTitle: Women in Leadership Summit deadline extended to Feb. 21
body:
The deadline to be part of the 11th annual Women in Leadership Summit has been extended. Register by 5 p.m. Wednesday, Feb. 21, for this one-day conference for aspiring and current female student leaders. The summit provides participants with leadership development workshops to enhance practical skills while fostering positive self-image.

The summit is Saturday, March 3, in Nedderman Hall and will include:

  • Networking breakfast
  • Keynote speaker Liz Plank, senior producer and correspondent at Vox.com, will present "Modern Feminism: It’s Not Just About Women"
  • Educational workshop sessions hosted by faculty, staff, and community leaders
  • Team-building activities
  • Small-group roundtable discussions
  • Door prizes and giveaways

For questions, email Sabrina Corsiga at sabrina.corsiga@mavs.uta.edu.

pageTitle: Video volunteers needed for Movin' Mavs tournament
body:
Help film games for this weekend's Movin' Mavs wheelchair basketball tournament. The games are Saturday-Sunday, Feb. 17-18, at the Physical Education Building (PEB) and the Maverick Activities Center (MAC). To volunteer, email Kenny Cofer at kenyarree.cofer@mavs.uta.edu.

See some of the best wheelchair basketball as teams from New York, Canada, Missouri, Houston, and Dallas compete in Arlington. Games and locations are:

Saturday, Feb. 17 @ PEB

  • 8 a.m.—Canada vs. Houston
  • 10 a.m.—Dallas vs. Houston
  • 12 p.m.—Dallas vs. Canada
  • 3 p.m.—Knockout Game 1
  • 5 p.m.—Knockout Game 2 vs. Lady Movin' Mavs
  • 7 p.m.—Knockout Game 3

Saturday, Feb. 17 @ MAC

  • 8 a.m.—New York vs. Missouri
  • 10 a.m.—UTA Movin' Mavs vs. Missouri
  • 12 p.m.—UTA Movin' Mavs vs. New York
  • 3 p.m.—Knockout Game 4
  • 7 p.m.—Knockout Game 5

Sunday, Feb. 18 @ PEB

  • 9 a.m.—UTA Lady Movin' Mavs vs. TBA

Sunday, Feb. 18 @ MAC

  • 9 a.m.—3rd Place Game
  • 11 a.m.—Championship Game

pageTitle: Run for Women Faculty and Staff Network board
body:
Nominations are needed for faculty co-chair-elect and secretary for the Women Faculty and Staff Network (WFSN).

If you or someone you know would be willing to serve as one of the foundational WFSN board members, please email your nomination to wfsn@uta.edu by noon Monday, March 12. Include the name of the candidate and the position, plus a brief statement of support. Self-nominations are welcome.

Join us for WFSN meetings at noon Monday, March 19, and Monday, April 16, in Room 100 of the Geoscience building. The slate of candidates will be announced in the March meeting. Voting will occur at the April meeting.

The WFSN provides a University-wide forum for the discussion of ideas and mutual concerns of women faculty and staff. Membership in the WFSN is open to any UTA faculty or staff member. 

If you have any questions, email wfsn@uta.edu.

pageTitle: UEP, TracDat training sessions available Friday and in March
body:
Unit Effectiveness Process (UEP) and TracDat training are offered by UTA's Institutional Effectiveness and Reporting.

Training sessions are:

  • 2-3 p.m. Friday, Feb. 23, E200 of the Continuing Education and Workforce Building
  • 10-11 a.m. Wednesday, March 21, E200D, Continuing Education and Workforce Building
  • 2-3 p.m. Thursday, March 22, E200D, Continuing Education and Workforce Building

RSVP to uep@uta.edu with your name and the session you wish to attend. While an RSVP is not necessary, computer stations will be limited, and those who RSVP first are guaranteed computer access during the training.

Learn more about UEP and TransDat online.

pageTitle: Early voting at MAC for primary election
body: UTA is a polling place for early voting in the Democratic and Republican primaries. Voting will be 7 a.m.-7 p.m. Monday, Feb. 26-Thursday, March 1, in the Maverick Activities Center. Election day is Tuesday, March 6. Learn more about the primaries on the Tarrant County Election Office website and at votetexas.gov.

pageTitle: Volunteer for SAC Benefits Fair
body: Lend a hand during the Staff Advisory Council's Benefits Fair on Wednesday, March 14. Sign up for one or more shifts. Help UTA staff check in, assist vendors, give away prizes, or aid with other tasks. Volunteer online.

pageTitle: Benefits Fair today in Bluebonnet Ballroom
body:
Join the Staff Advisory Council for the 11th Annual Benefits Fair 11 a.m.-1:30 p.m. today, Wednesday, March 14, in the Bluebonnet Ballroom at the University Center.

There will be vendors from Human Resources, UTA campus partners, and the Arlington community. Some vendors offer assessment testing, and Carter Blood will collect blood donations. A giveaway is for the first 300 people that arrive, and food vendors will hand out free food, while supplies last.

All staff and faculty are invited.

pageTitle: Stay informed through MyAbram website
body:
Stay up-to-date on the downtown Arlington construction project through the MyAbram website for lane closures, construction milestones, and other important information during the two-year project.

You also can track the progress of this project and many others throughout Arlington by visiting the city’s Street Tracker webpage.

The City of Arlington has partnered with Waze to give drivers the best experience possible to get around town. Drivers can download Waze for free at waze.com/get for iOS and Android and see real-time traffic, find optimal routes, avoid road closures, and more.

pageTitle: Give shoes to benefit local community
body:
UTA's Office of Sustainability and Soles4Souls are partnering for a shoe drive to help people living in poverty gain new dignity, courage, and hope. Donate your gently used shoes March 1-April 18.

Collection boxes are at the University Center, Central Library, and the Maverick Activities Center. Or bring your shoes to the UTA Earth Day celebration 11 a.m.-1 p.m. Wednesday, April 18, on the University Center mall.

Volunteers also are needed for the campus drive.

For more details, contact Charlotte Duncan, 817-272-2228; Angella Ezell, 817-272-5667; or Becky Valentich, 817-272-0199.

pageTitle: University College soon to be Division of Student Success
body:
University College will be renamed the Division of Student Success, a part of UTA's Academic Affairs, effective March 15.

Ashley Purgason has been named associate vice provost for the division. Dr. Purgason previously served as assistant vice president for strategic initiatives in the Office of the President, and she was assistant dean for undergraduate research and student advancement in the College of Science. She teaches courses in biology.

The division will continue to be a focal point for first-year students and play an important role in their development, learning, and success. The new division will actively collaborate with schools and colleges to deploy academic support services. Additionally, the unit will help returning learners and students seeking to complete their degrees in a timely manner.

The Division of Student Success is located in Ransom Hall and is home to the University Advising Center, the McNair Scholars Program, Trio-Student Support Services, University Tutorial and Supplemental Instruction, Testing Services, and University Studies. The division is sponsors programming such as the Success Series workshops, Freshman Interest Groups, the Resource Hotline, and Success U.

The Interdisciplinary Studies program will move to the Honors College under the direction of Interim Dean Kevin Gustafson. Interdisciplinary Studies provides students the opportunity to develop individualized programs of study—often in conjunction with existing certificates and minors—to meet their personal, academic, and professional goals.

pageTitle: Network upgrades continue on Sunday mornings
body:
The UTA network will undergo extensive maintenance and upgrades in February. 

Upcoming network maintenance is scheduled for 2-7 a.m. Sunday, Feb. 18 and 25.

The UTA network will undergo infrastructure upgrades that will ensure continued stability and reliability of the internet, network, and IT services for the campus community. During these upgrades, there will be a temporary disruption in network services during IT regular maintenance to limit any impact to business activities. UTA resources—such as shared drives, Pharos Printing, and other network-accessed resources—will be temporarily unavailable during these upgrades.

Faculty, staff, and students will not have access to UTA network-accessed resources during the upgrades. The Office of Information Technology recommends faculty, staff, and students make other work and school arrangements to avoid any service or work interruptions.

For more information about the schedule, please visit uta.edu/oit. If you have questions or concerns, contact the IT Help Desk at 817-272-2208 or helpdesk@uta.edu, or use the self-service website.

pageTitle: Grad Finale next week at UTA Bookstore
body:
Find everything you need for spring Commencement at the Grad Finale Monday-Thursday, March 5-8, at the UTA Bookstore. Grad Finale hours are 10 a.m.-4 p.m. Monday-Tuesday and 10 a.m.-7 p.m. Wednesday-Thursday. 

Graduation candidates can find caps and gowns, announcements, the official UTA ring, fashion rings, and diploma frames.

Get complimentary Starbucks coupons while supplies last.

pageTitle: Candidates for dean of the College of Business to visit campus
body:
Candidates for dean of the College of Business will each have an open session for the University community—faculty, staff, and students—Thursday-Friday, March 1-2, and Tuesday-Thursday, March 6-8. Each candidate will speak and then answer questions.

The candidate's name will be released 24 hours in advance of his or her campus visit.

Scheduled sessions, all in Room 609 of the Business Building, are:

• 1:15 p.m. Thursday, March 1

• 1:15 p.m. Friday, March 2

• 2:15 p.m. Tuesday, March 6

• 2:30 p.m. Wednesday, March 7

• 2:30 p.m. Thursday, March 8

Visit the Senior Leadership Searches webpage to learn more about the dean search for the College of Business as details become available.

pageTitle: New Help Center offers campus answers
body:
UTA Help Center, a new web resource offered by the Office of Information Technology, helps faculty, staff, students, or visitors find answers to questions across the University in one simple location. Something as simple as “How do I pay for tuition” or “How do I get a parking pass” can be quickly located. UTA Help Center directs users to the appropriate department by clicking on the quick links that relate to their questions.

Need Help? Start at UTA Help Center located at uta.edu/help.

pageTitle: Keep UT System Active provides fitness rewards
body:
Waltz, walk, or run across Texas—virtually—in the Keep UT System Active challenge, which provides amazing images and vivid descriptions of UT System institution landmarks. The program is designed to help you practice healthy habits.

Team up with colleagues to compete against other UT System institutions for the coveted traveling trophy. Keep up your healthy habits throughout the four-week challenge to earn your Living Well rewards: a cooling towel and a running belt. View the video.

The overall program goal is to earn 100 points, 25 points per week, within the four-week challenge. A member will accrue miles when logging steps, sleep, and water consumption on a daily basis.

  • Registration: March 19-April 9
  • Challenge Period: April 2-29
  • Grace Period: April 30-May 1

Register at utlivingwell.com.

pageTitle: Drug-Free Schools and Communities Act Notification
body:
Health risks associated with drug and alcohol abuse

  • Alcohol and Drug Awareness
  • Illicit Drugs and Alcohol Abuse (Brochures are at UTA Police Department and Health Services)

University policies related to the illegal possession, use, or distribution of drugs or alcohol

  • Drug and Alcohol Testing Policy
  • Alcohol and Drug-Free Workplace Policy
  • Drug-Free University Community and Workplace Policy
  • Drugs and Alcohol Policy

Availability of treatment for drug or alcohol problems

Employees—Employee Assistance Program (EAP) is provided through UTA’s Office of Human Resources at 1-800-343-3822 or visit alliancewp.com.

Students—Drug and alcohol counseling and referral services are available through UTA Health Services at 2-2771 or uta.edu/healthservices. The Center for Students in Recovery is a resource for students struggling to stay sober.

Internal sanctions and federal, state, and local legal penalties that may result from the illegal sale, possession, consumption, or distribution of drugs or alcohol

  • Disciplinary Penalties
  • Student Conduct and Discipline
  • Standards of Conduct Guide

For more information, contact UTA's Health Services at 817-272-2771 or visit uta.edu/healthservices.

pageTitle: Friday deadline for The Big Event site leader applications
body:
The Big Event—UTA's largest day of volunteer service—needs site leaders to oversee tasks at the project sites and act as liaisons between volunteers, the executive board, and project site coordinators. Apply online by Friday, Feb. 9. 

With more than 45 project sites, this year's Big Event needs twice as many site leaders as previous years.

Students, faculty, staff, and Arlington community members volunteer for four hours at various project sites, such as shelters, parks, libraries, and more throughout North Texas. This year's event is the morning of Saturday, April 14, followed by a celebration for participants with free food, drinks, and live music.

For more details, visit uta.edu/bigevent. If you have any questions, email thebigevent@uta.edu.

pageTitle: Black History Month lectures on Wednesdays in February
body:
The African American Faculty and Staff Association hosts weekly speakers during Black History Month. The lectures are 1-2 p.m. Wednesdays in February in the sixth floor parlor of the Central Library. Scheduled speakers are:

• Feb. 7, W. Marvin Dulaney, an author and UTA associate professor of history emeritus.

• Feb. 14, Reality Canty, senior UX researcher of design technology at AT&T in North Texas.

• Feb. 21, Kristin Carothers, clinical psychologist in the ADHD and Behavior Disorders Center at the Child Mind Institute, a New York City-based nonprofit dedicated to children struggling with mental health and learning disorders.

• Feb. 28, Esther Terry, former president of Bennett College, a private four-year historically black liberal arts college for women in Greensboro, N.C.

pageTitle: Free Naturally Slim program a UT System benefit
body:
Learn how to lose weight and improve your health while eating the foods you love with Naturally Slim, a free online program offered through the UT System's Living Well program.

Naturally Slim is an online program that focuses on behavior modification, not dieting, for sustainable results. Via weekly videos and online tools, you will learn techniques to lose weight by changing your relationship with food. The free, personalized course includes ongoing access to help you maintain your weight loss long-term.

Apply by Friday, March 16, at naturallyslim.com/livingwell.

The Naturally Slim program starts Monday, April 2, and is available to all UT Select Medical Plan members age 18 and older, including employees, retirees, spouses, and dependents.

pageTitle: Sign up for The Big Event
body:
The Big Event, UTA’s largest day of community service, is open for you to volunteer for a project 9 a.m.-1 p.m. Saturday, April 14. Volunteer opportunities include Mission Arlington, the Dallas Arboretum, food banks, libraries, animal services, and other projects on campus and across the DFW area.

Volunteers will receive a free shirt and are invited to the Thank You Celebration afterward with free food.

Sign up for a project at uta.edu/thebigevent by Friday, March 23. Group and individual entries are accepted.

Questions? Email thebigevent@uta.edu

pageTitle: MyMav unavailable this weekend
body:
MyMav, the student information system, will be unavailable during an update scheduled for 5 p.m. Friday, March 9, until 8 a.m. Monday, March 12.

This maintenance is part of an initiative of the Office of Business Affairs, Enrollment Management, and the Office of Information Technology to provide resources that improve faculty, staff, and student experiences. This update will lay the foundation for future MyMav improvements.

During this upgrade, students will not have access to register for classes, review grades, or make payments. Students will not see any visible changes after the update and can resume normal operation of MyMav at 8 a.m. Monday, March 12.

If you have any questions, comments, or concerns, please contact the IT Help Desk at 817-272-2208, helpdesk@uta.edu, or use the self-service portal.

pageTitle: University voicemail unavailable on Sunday
body:
Faculty and staff will not have access to the University voicemail system during a routine maintenance scheduled 2-5 a.m. Sunday, March 4. Normal operation of the voicemail system will resume after the completion of the maintenance.

If you have any questions, comments, or concerns, please contact the IT Help Desk at 817-272-2208, helpdesk@uta.edu, or through the self-service portal.
